page.title: 12POTTERY POND, SWINTON
page.content: A popular outing for the family is to the Pottery Pond at the site of the old Rockingham Pottery in Swinton. The Flint Mill Pond and the Waterloo Kiln are all that remain of the pottery business. The pottery was made famous by the patronage of the Marquis of Rockingham. When children go there they like to dip for tadpoles and small fish. There are pleasant paths to walk around and a neat little park and picnic area. The Waterloo Kiln is the biggest ever built by the Rockingham Company. It was built after the British Victory at the Battle of Waterloo in 1815.
